revised_title: Inflation and Deformation of Thin Elastic Shells
tldr: The authors study the large elastic deformation of incompressible isotropic materials, focusing on the inflation of a circular diaphragm. They apply the theory to a problem involving thin shells and use numerical integration to calculate the state of deformation throughout the inflated diaphragm. The Mooney form is employed for the stored-energy function, simplifying the calculations.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Mechanics of Materials
